description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides support for the humanitarian response to communities affected by Cyclone Giri which made landfall on 22nd October 2010 in Rakhine State. This assistance is designed with 3 components: provision of assistance and relief to the most affected households from the townships on the western coast of Rakhine State. This component will be a grant provided to the International Federation of the Red Cross (IFRC) via the Australian Red Cross (ARC); grant to the World Food Program (WFP) to provide food assistance to affected communities; and provision of emergency shelter, water, sanitation, hygiene, basic health and child friendly spaces to affected communities. The total value of this initiative is $3.0 million expensed over the 2010-11 financial year.
